comments:
Trying to start the Navigator view in the runtime workbench always fails on me with the exception below. Funny enough, this does not depend on which plugin I am starting (I tried several). 

This happens whenever I only select the plugin and then "Add Required Plugins" in the launch configuration (i.e. if I start it with the minimal set of plugins only). If I start it with ALL plugins selected (or the "launch with all workspace and enabled plug-ins" option chosen) then the Navigator view comes up fine. So, apparently, the Navigator view is not part of the required plugins any more. But it is required to be able to select a project or any file, so it should be required! Or maybe just some dependency is wrong or rather forgotten?

Exception:
Unable to create view: Plug-in "org.eclipse.ui.ide" was unable to instantiate class "org.eclipse.ui.views.navigator.ResourceNavigator".

"Details"-button reveals:

Michael
*** Bug 165656 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Which plug-in/s did you initially select before hitting the "add required plug-ins" button?

The button is meant to add dependencies for your specific plyug-in, not the minimal set of plug-ins to get the UI to come up.  If you created a plug-in with no UI components (or UI dependencies), few if any of the ui plug-ins might get added.  This would probably result in errors in the UI.  But, the plug-in you tested should still be able to run correctly.

(In reply to comment #2)
> Which plug-in/s did you initially select before hitting the "add required
> plug-ins" button?

I had been trying to run a diagram editor plugin that I had developed using
GMF. These diagram editors require to be able to create and select projects, since the diagram files it creates are resources that are part of a project. 
Hence the Navigator View is a required prerequisite to be able to use it.

But maybe I should rather suggest to the GMF folks to make sure that this
plugin is somewhere referenced in the code they generate...

Michael

PS.: sorry for posting this to both bugs, I had become confused, which one was declared duplicate of which....
